material.mattext: Which of the following is the correct output?

Incorrect. Note that 0 falls outside the 95% confidence interval for μ<font size="9">1</font>-μ<font size="9">2</font>, which means that Ho can be rejected in favor of the two sided alternative. On the other hand the p-value is large (.289) indicating that Ho cannot be rejected.... Something is wrong here!

Incorrect. Note that 0 falls inside the 95% confidence interval for μ<font size="9">1</font>-μ<font size="9">2</font>, which means that Ho cannot be rejected. On the other hand the p-value is small (.003) indicating that Ho can be rejected.... Something is wrong here!

Good Job! Indeed, this is the correct output, since it is the only one out of the three where both the confidence interval and p-value lead us to the same conclusion (as it should be). Note that 0 falls inside the 95% confidence interval for μ<font size="9">1</font>-μ<font size="9">2</font>, which means that Ho cannot be rejected. Also, the p-value is large (.223) indicating that Ho cannot be rejected.
